sect3.title: New objects cannot be assigned by reference
sect3.para: The result of the &new; statement can no longer be assigned to a variable by reference:
sect3.informalexample:
<?php
class C {}
$c =& new C;
?>

sect3.title: Calls from incompatible context removed
sect3.para: Previously deprecated in PHP 5.6, static calls made to a non-static method with an incompatible context will now result in the called method having an undefined $this variable and a deprecation warning being issued.
sect3.informalexample:
<?php
class A {
    public function test() { var_dump($this); }
}

// Note: Does NOT extend A
class B {
    public function callNonStaticMethodOfA() { A::test(); }
}

(new B)->callNonStaticMethodOfA();
?>

sect3.title: &yield; is now a right associative operator
sect3.para: The &yield; construct no longer requires parentheses, and has been changed to a right associative operator with precedence between print and =>. This can result in changed behaviour:

informalexample.programlisting:
<?php
echo yield -1;
// Was previously interpreted as
echo (yield) - 1;
// And is now interpreted as
echo yield (-1);

yield $foo or die;
// Was previously interpreted as
yield ($foo or die);
// And is now interpreted as
(yield $foo) or die;
?>

sect3.para: Parentheses can be used to disambiguate those cases.

sect3.title: $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA removed
sect3.para: $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA is no longer available. The php://input stream should be used instead.

sect3.title: # comments in INI files removed
sect3.para: Support for prefixing comments with # in INI files has been removed. ; should be used instead.
